meanings.sent1: The explorers colonises the new land, building homes and farms.
meanings.sent2: The settlers colonises the island, creating a new community.
meanings.sent3: The ants colonises the picnic area, claiming all the crumbs for themselves.
meanings.sent4: The vines colonises the garden, spreading and taking over the flower beds.
meanings.sent5: The bacteria colonises the petri dish, multiplying rapidly in the nutrient-rich environment.

meanings.definition: Settle among and establish control over (the indigenous people of an area).
meanings.sent1: The conquerors colonises the native tribes, imposing their laws and customs.
meanings.sent2: The invaders colonises the region, subjugating the local population.
meanings.sent3: The tourists jokingly pretend to colonises the souvenir shop, buying up all the trinkets.
meanings.sent4: The weeds colonises the garden, choking out the flowers and vegetables.
meanings.sent5: The mold colonises the damp corner of the basement, spreading its musty smell throughout the room.
